la
CONFIDENIIAL
Hongkong - June 10th
149
Dear Family:
I left San Francisco May 24th on one of PAA's new Boeing
Streto-
cruisers which carries 61 passengers on the upper deck and has space for 17
more in a lower deck lounge reached by a circuler staircase.
The plane is
pressurized
right from ses-level so there is no effeet on your
eers at all.
Our crossing in ten hours compares with my first crossing
years
ago
of 20
hours or more.
Bondy met me in Honolulu and drove me to the Royal Hwalian where a
room had been reserved for me.
The guests all looked like black market op-
eretors and I guess to stay there they have to be.
I asked
for a
special rate
and got it - otherwise would have paid $30 per day.
The
second
Debby Blekewell over on Kaual and asked her to have lunch
day
I "phoned
with me at
the most
attractive Kaual Inn near Lahul.
She was so excited that
she
nearly
dropped
the Iphone and I had to repeat everything I said to be sure
she got
it all
straight.
Kaual is only an hour by air from Honolulu but the airport is at
one end of the Island and Debby and Pompy at the other end some 40 minutes
drive by car.
Debby met me in her British Ford - Pompy
joined
uS
for lunch
and we had lots of walla walle,
saw the kids - very cute -
the new house on
the beach which is just perfect, and then they drove me
beck.
to
the sirport.
Left Honolulu the next afternoon in a DG-/, Sleeperette and flew direct
to Wake arriving there in the middle of the night so couldn't work the beach
for sea shells as I had on my previous trip.
On to Tokyo arriving there May
30 early in the afternoon.
We laid over there until 2:30 a.m.
when we de-
parted for Okinawa - a refueling stop while Shanghai is closed .
We arrived
there early in the morning and stayed on the ground about an hour and one-half.
The harbors are dotted with the wrecks of ships many of which were American
boats caught there in a typhoon after V-j Day.
There was a long stretch of beach
near the airport but the PAA manager said no shells.
The latter are on the
Pacific side some ten miles away where the boys go swimming.
He is going to
get some for me including "cats' eyes" which normally are found only in New
Zealand.
We arrived Hongkong after a flight along the east coast of Formosa.
The nountains of thet island rise up 1400 feet and while our direct flight
from Okinawa to Hongkong would take us diructly across formosa we don't fly
that high in the DC-4's ao - as previously stated - flew'along a most for-
biddirs coast.
The mountains come right down to the beach or terminate in
abrupt cliffs sgainst which break the long rollers of the Pacific.
In more
Chan 30 miles of coast line I saw no sign of habitation either on the coast
or back in the mountains - where dwell, I an told, an unconquered aborigine
mountain people who have held those mountain fastnesses against Chinese and
Japanese alike.
Toward the southern tip of Formose the mountains trail off
into a long flat point where there are small villages and farms.
We flew over
DESHUSIAOS
JusT lalted to A in Manila
